definition: touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Recognition of the Paraclete in the New Prophecy was their touchstone of authenticity.
sentences.chinese: 圣灵认识在新预言是其真实性的试金石。

sentences.english: That is the touchstone of our efforts in all these areas.
sentences.chinese: 对于我们在所有这些方面的努力，这是一个试金石。

sentences.english: Problems are the serious test that tells us success from failure.
sentences.chinese: 问题是帮我们辨别成功和失败的重要的试金石。

sentences.english: The degree of internal stability is the litmus test of nation's credit- worthiness .
sentences.chinese: 一个国家内部的稳定程度是其值得信任度的试金石。

sentences.english: Calamity and prisperity are the touchstones of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 可怜与荣幸都是正直的试金石。

sentences.english: Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men.
sentences.chinese: 真金不怕火炼，逆境是强者的试金石。

sentences.english: A man's deed is the touchstone of his greatness or littleness.
sentences.chinese: 行动是一个人伟大或者渺小的试金石。

sentences.english: The overall view is the touchstone for the differentiation between professional oncologists and non-professionals.
sentences.chinese: 大局观是区别职业与非职业肿瘤医师的试金石。

sentences.english: But, just as with England, Rooney is the true touchstone.
sentences.chinese: 但正如英格兰国家队，鲁尼才是真正的试金石。

sentences.english: This is the examination about the human and the human thing all theories touchstones.
sentences.chinese: 这是检验关于人和人类事物一切理论的试金石。

sentences.english: Dreams are the touchstones of our character.
They are the standard of character, the revealer of doctrines, and the test of experience.
sentences.chinese: 它是品格的标准，真道的启示者和经验的试金石。

sentences.english: The Jewish people, as a testing agent, has unfortunately never erred.
sentences.chinese: 犹太民族在做试金石的时候，不幸还没有发生过错误。

sentences.english: The ablity to handle crisis is the touchstone of a society's legal system.
sentences.chinese: 一个社会对危机的处理是其法治程度的试金石。

sentences.english: Calamity is man's true touch stone .
sentences.chinese: 灾祸是吾人真正的试金石。

sentences.english: Emerson was a touchstone, and Salinger often quoted him in letters.
sentences.chinese: 艾默生是一块试金石，塞林格经常在信里引用他的话。

definition: to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
lit. a brick as a door knocker (idiom); fig. a temporary expedient/to use sb as a stepping stone to fortune
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
hard power (i.e. military and economic power)
to regard as/to look upon as
whether or not/can it or can't it/is it possible?
solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
